intro: Hymenoxys californica, commonly known as the California bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. The plant has a short, upright stem with alternate, pinnately divided leaves. It produces small, round, green pods that contain several seeds. Hymenoxys californica typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and grasslands.
